Reviewing after 1 month of usage.I have tried to cover every aspects. My review may seem a bit cluttered as I have mixed the pros and cons. So kindly read the whole review. Let's start:- Packaging= Neat packaging by Xiaomi. Inside the box you get the phone itself , black colour translucent back cover , manual , charger , micro usb cable and sim ejector tool. Display= Only thing I can say about the display is "crisp". 18:9 aspect ratio looks wonderful and feels like you are holding a high end smart phone Battery= I was using a Lenovo vibe P1 earlier which had a 5000 mah battery and lasted more than 1 and half-day. So I was a bit skeptical about the battery life , as this phone is having a 4000 mah battery. But , it really surprised me. Lasts for about 30hrs with casual usage and with heavy usage it lasts for a day. Sadly Xiaomi haven't included a fast charger which is very disappointing as this phone supports QC 2.0 , If you want one then check in the MI app. Camera= Isn't the best around in its segment. Gets the same cameras as that of the RN4 with some improvements. I feel it could have been way more better. I would say it's "ok". Front camera lacks quality and the rear camera performs good in the daylight. However , both the cameras (front and rear) doesn't clicks good quality picture in artificial/indoor lighting.Totally not recommended for camera/selfie lovers. Performance= The Snapdragon 625 has become quite old now and should have been replaced with the newer ones (Atleast with the 626). But that doesn't means it is a bad processor. Thanks to the 4 GB ram , the doesn't exhibit any lag at all. Gaming performance is descent enough. I have played asphalt 8(high graphics) , dead trigger 2 and gangster Vegas on it. No lags , no frame drops. Handles well and the phone doesn't gets much heated. Build quality= Seems good. I personally feel it isn't very durable as it is very sleek and the display looks very very fragile.The case included with the box will not provide any protection from accidental drops.It will just protect the phone's back from getting scratches and will offer some grip. I strongly recommend you to buy a bumper case and a tempered glass. Sensors= Has almost all the sensors one could aspire for in a mid-range phone. Except NFC. UI= MIUI is very engaging , uber responsive and butter smooth. It is one of the main reason for the smooth and lag free experience. However, there is a lot of bloatware. Some of which can be removed. Verdict= Go for it if you are a casual user who doesn't takes much pictures and want a ideal phone. I would say it is a value for money composition. Have a nice day.
